transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Greetings and hello, this is Tansut, welcoming you to another Space Ghost Coast to Coast. Tonight, entomologist Dr. Maxcy Nolan, and exterminator Steve Arnold. Nobody special, but we think they're funny. That counts for somethin', don't it? Well, don't it?! Nobody listens to me! I don't know why I bother! (crying) Here's Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Greetings, one and all, I'm Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So what?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares back)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Go on and start the dumb show!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Actually, we're not doing our regular show tonight, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You mean it won't stink?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) And so it begins. No, Zorak, I'm saying that I have a special surprise for you tonight. (drum roll) Zorak, here... is... your... (cymbal crash) life!

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (applause)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (sputters, wide-eyed) What!?! (shot of all-mantis audience) Oh, great. Moltar! Why didn't you warn me?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, nobody tells me anything.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right, Zorak. Moltar didn't know a thing about this. You see, I only told two special friends of yours. And then they told two friends, and then they told two friends. And so on, and so on, and so on... (as he talks, the screen splits into two, then four, then eight, and then sixteen talking Space Ghosts.)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, I don't want no stinky "here is your life". It's embarrassing.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, hush up, Mr. Party Poop Bug. It'll be fun, fun, fun! We're gonna have guests who'll talk about you, and surprises. And afterwards, we're all going to a party downtown at the Taco King.

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (applause)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: The Taco King?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (reciting a jingle) "It's where the refried bean reigns supreme."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk, big band music plays from scratchy record in background; music stops as needle is dragged across record) Alrighty! (fanfare plays) Zorak, here comes your life! (fanfare finishes)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Can't we skip this garbage and go straight to the tacos?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, now pipe down. (more big band background music) (clears throat) Ah, Zorak, what can one say? (family portrait with father, mother, two older siblings and baby Zorak; siblings dissappear one by one as Space Ghost speaks, followed by father's head) Born into a small family made even smaller by disgusting acts of cannibalism, you quickly entered into young bughood (police mug shot of Zorak in a leather jacket), and a life of evil.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hail, evil!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hail, evil!

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (wild applause)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) May I continue?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Sure, it's your show.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, Zorak, tell me if you remember this voice, from your criminal past:

transcript.speaker: Metallus
transcript.dialogue: (drones and drones)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (listens) Nnn- uh uh.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh. Well, uh... do you remember this voice?

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Hi, Zorak, my name is Brak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hmmmmm... Sorry, doesn't ring a bell.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This one?

transcript.speaker: Weird Al Yankovic
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Zorak, you... evil locust!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Nope.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aaaaaa! Work with me here! Now, do you know this voice?

transcript.speaker: Cyclo
transcript.dialogue: Hey there, Zorak, remember that cavity search Warden Smith put us through that one wacky New Year's?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (looks surprised at first) I give up.

transcript.speaker: Cyclo
transcript.dialogue: You're not even trying, are you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (aside) Sh, don't give him any hints.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I don't know. Steve?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, no, no! Lord, man, don't you know your own life? It's your old cell mate, from Prison Planet Alpha DD-7, master villain and would-be world conqueror, Cyclo!

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (applause)

transcript.speaker: Cyclo
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey... Cyclo. So... what'cha been doing?

transcript.speaker: Cyclo
transcript.dialogue: Oh, the usual, ten to life.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Eh, sorry.

transcript.speaker: Cyclo
transcript.dialogue: (shrugs) Well, see ya, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, yeah. So long, Cyclo.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, uh, Cyclo, will you be joining us at the Taco Master after the show?

transcript.speaker: Cyclo
transcript.dialogue: I can't, stupid, I'm in jail! (fades from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah, right.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Being here tonight reminds me of how much I miss prison.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Isn't this "here is your life" stuff great, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: If we're really gonna do this, I gotta go change vests.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, here's our first special guest, to tell us all about Zorak and his ilk.

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (applause)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, citizen! Welcome to Zorak's life!

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: Hi there.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Identify yourself to the universe, please.

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: I'm Maxcy Nolan, professor of entomology at the University of Georgia.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um, that means "bug guy", right?

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Great! We brought you here tonight to talk to us about our little friend...

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: The great Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (wild applause)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um, look, friend, I know Zorak, okay? And, he's not that great. Got that?

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good. As I was saying, this is our mantis of the quarter hour, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: Hi, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (drinks coffee) Kiss my..

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Pretty scary, eh, eh?

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: Yes, yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Freaky, in fact.

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: Six feet in size, and a praying mantis at that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And evil to boot.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, technically, is Zorak an insect or a pest?

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: What is your definition of a pest?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I don't know, I asked you.

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: A plant out of place is called what?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A transplant?

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: A weed.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I knew that.

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: An insect that's out of place, and doing bad things is called..

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A weed!

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: A pest.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Exactly!

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: What category should we place Zorak in today?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) I think that's very clear.

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: Pest.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yep, he's a pesty insect pest. But shouldn't he have six legs?

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: Well, they're supposed to have six legs; how many legs does Zorak have?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Two legs, um, two arms, kinda got a beak...

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: Is it possible that under that red vest (shot of Zorak in a blue vest) ... red vest (shot of Zorak in a red vest) he is carrying an extra set of arms, that no one has found out about yet.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ihhh! Barf!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Actually, that's where I keep my Mintøs. (pulls out Mintøs) (Ding!) Das Freshmaker! (three note orchestra hit)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Have you ever dipped a mantis into rich creamy milk chocolate?

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: Mmmmmm!

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: I've taken mantis, and I have dipped them in alcohol, and made 'em drunk.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Woo hoo!! Sign me up! Hello, sailor!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why do you like these evil green things anyway?

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: One thing that I found just the most absolutely amazing about the mantises, is the fact that they can stand motionless, for hours. Literally not moving any body part that is visible.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Actually, nobody moves much in a Hanna-Barbera cartoon.

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: That's very interesting.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Not really. Well, thanks for being with us, Mr. Nolan, and telling us all about... pests. Will we see you at Ye Olde Taco Shoppe after the big show?

transcript.speaker: Maxcy Nolan
transcript.dialogue: Chomp, chomp, chomp.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh? I'll... take that as a maybe. (Dr. Nolan fades from the monitor) Okay, folks, next we have an old film clip of Zorak to show you.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ye gods! You're not gonna show that old thing, are ya?!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right. We're going to see the first time I ever met our evil weevil little bug pal, and beat the living daylights out of him. It's called, simply, "Zorak". Enjoy!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, sorry, man.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So, Space Ghost is not here. But he left us two hostages. I can still have my revenge!

transcript.speaker: Jace
transcript.dialogue: Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Come!

transcript.speaker: Jace
transcript.dialogue: Where are we going?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (attaches note to door with daggar) No questions!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (with Blip on shoulder, reading note; audience boos) "It's a trade! Your life for my hostages!" Signed, Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (watching clip on monitor, Jan & Jace are on screen) Tsk! Those stupid kids! Why did I even bother?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What have you done with Jan and Jace, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (audience cheers) They are right here, Space Ghost. And, they are still alive, and they will stay that way if you follow orders. It's your life I want, not the hostages. (audience applause again)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Man, Zorak, what was with your voice back then?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well, what's up with your voice?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Those sounds you hear are my killer mosquitoids, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in studio) (sarcastic) Not the killer mosquittos! Ooooh! (giving a play by play) Okay, watch what I do here. (laughs) You thought you had me there, didn't you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) (seeing Blip by the Phantom Cruiser) It's Blip! With my power bands! (lands pod next to cruiser; mosquitoids zoom by) (as he puts on power bands) Good work, Blip!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (watching Space Ghost blast the mosquitoids) Space Ghost has regained his powers! (looks at Jan & Jace) Take them to the flying bomb! (audience cheers)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I've got to get them out! (zooms off)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (sarcastic) Flying time bomb? Heh! Brilliant.

transcript.speaker: Jace
transcript.dialogue: Boy, are we glad to see you! (audience boos)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No time to talk, take these emergency rocket packs and eject, fast! I'll head this ship back to Zorak with our best wishes. (Jan & Jace eject) There, Zorak, let's see if you can take it, as well as you can dish it out!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (in studio) Uh, do we need to watch this part?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in studio) Oh, hold on, hold on. This is so good!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughing) Did ya, did you see that, where I blew up his planet? Hoo hoo, oh man!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Feh! I would have defeated you, if it wasn't for those meddling kids. (looks at camera briefly, then turns back) And that monkey.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Well, I mean, putting jet packs in the rocket? Eh, that's not too swift.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, shut up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Moltar! Let's see that footage of Zorak's planet blowing up, one more time.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (rewinds tape on control room monitor, throws lever. Replay of planet destruction scene from previous cartoon appears on screen)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Ahem, sorry.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughing) I'm sorry, Zorak, I, I'm not laughing at you, I was, I was, well, well okay, I was laughing at you! (laughs) Say, Zorak, just how did you escape certain death when I blew up your planet?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I, I crouched.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Crouched?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Down low, behind a rock.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Our next guest is an expert in pest control. That means killing insects.

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (boos)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, citizen, welcome to Zorak's life.

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Thank you for having me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Identify yourself, please.

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Steve Arnold, Peachtree Pest Control.

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (boos)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Boo! Boo!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Pest control?

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Mmm, that's right, pest control.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That means you kill insects, right?

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Ah, yeah, we try not to use those words if possible.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why not? Them's good words! Say, Steve... You know, I need help controlling a pest.

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Ah, yeah, I was afraid you was gonna bring him up.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, he's my, uh...

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: I know. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, you know who he is?

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Know him quite well.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Gonna getcha!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Woo-o-o-o, pretty scary, isn't he?

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Uh, only when he's looking my way.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Gonna getcha!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What would you use to control pests like Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Uh, hammers, bricks, two by fours...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You go right at it, huh?

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: I go in there with intent to kill, destroy, eliminate.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sounds good! Do you have anything cool you say right before you whack 'em?

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Take this.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Take this. Hmmmm... Take this. Take this. Take this. Take this. Take this and this and this. And this. I like it very much.

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: It's short, it's simple, and usually works.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do you.. mind if I use it? Can I take 'take this'?

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: It's yours.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Thanks! Say, Steve, what else can we learn about mantii?

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: The mantis family has a tendency to be cannibalistic of their own kind.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (belches) (sniff sniff) Mom?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Knew that one already, thanks.

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Mm.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Here's a stumper: any idea why mantises wear cheap polyester vests?

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Uh, to impress the females, I would assume. It used to work in the sixties, back here on Earth. It doesn't work now, does it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do any other pests wear polyester?

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Uh, no, mattafact, most of 'em have moved up into the wools and silk blends.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Well, thanks for being with us, Mr. Insect Killer.

transcript.speaker: Steve Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Thank you for having me. (fades from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Gonna getcha!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, Zorak, there you have it. Your miserable little life.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I only have one thing to say. Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (holding ray gun) Here is your death!! (evil laugh; fires at Space Ghost, hits his face)

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (applause and cheers)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ow! Jerk! That hurt!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It was supposed to!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I see. Well, 'take that!'

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: This.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This! (blasts Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (boos)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (crisped) Ih, what a night. I've never been so humiliated. I wish... I wish I'd never been born! (harp music; picture turns to black and white) Hey, what's going on? Is Turner de-colorizing now?

transcript.speaker: Raymond
transcript.dialogue: (appears on Zorak's pod, with a halo, but no wings) Hello!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Zuzu's petals! Raymond?! But, it can't be! I ate you episodes ago!

transcript.speaker: Raymond
transcript.dialogue: I'm an angel now, Uncle Zorak, second class! And I'm here to show you what life would have been like, if you had never been born!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, brother. Everybody has to do schtick.

transcript.speaker: Raymond
transcript.dialogue: Look, Uncle Zorak. If you hadn't been born, "Different Strokes" would still be on the air. (studio monitor shows cartoon still of "Different Strokes" cast)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (Gary Coleman voice) What you talkin' about, Raymond?

transcript.speaker: Raymond
transcript.dialogue: Lokar would have gotten your job on the show. (studio monitor shows still of Lokar in the keyboard pod)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No way!

transcript.speaker: Raymond
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost's show would have been a huge success! He would have been elected governor of California, and then president of the whole universe! (studio monitor shows various stills of Space Ghost)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What?! You mean all that would have happened if I wasn't born? Raymond, I want to live! I want to make Space Ghost miserable!

transcript.speaker: Raymond
transcript.dialogue: (harp music) (sprouts wings with a "pop!") Yay! Thanks, Uncle Zorak! (floats upward and away, with his new wings, to the Pearly Gates)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (back in color, un-crisped) I'm alive! You hear that, you ol' Ghost Planet? Alive!
